message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of natural language processing (cs.CL) because it presents a novel neural architecture for learning task-specific transformation functions on top of general-purpose word embeddings to model the relation of lexical entailment. It also uses a limited amount of supervision from task-specific scores on a subset of the vocabulary. Additionally, the paper may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories due to the use of neural networks and the development of a new architecture. The paper may also be relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR) and neural networks (cs.NE) sub-categories due to the use of vector space models and neural networks for modeling lexical entailment.
